private_information: I can only move blocks with vowels.
I can only hold one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Help reorder the blocks by moving only vowel-labeled blocks.

private_information: I can only move blocks with consonants.
I can only hold one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Help reorder the blocks by moving only consonant-labeled blocks.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the vowel and consonant agents to reorder all the blocks according to the target configuration, minimizing the number of steps.

public_information: There are 10 blocks on the table.
Some blocks are labeled with vowels, others with consonants.
Each agent can only move blocks of their type (vowel or consonant).
Each agent can only hold one block at a time.
The goal is to reorder the blocks into the target configuration while minimizing steps.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL. You provide a PDDL domain and problem file for manipulating vowel blocks. Always enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.

You are an expert in PDDL. You provide a PDDL domain and problem file for manipulating consonant blocks. Always enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.

You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL. You integrate PDDL domains and problems from multiple agents into a coherent multi-agent plan. Always enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Keep agents’ actions distinct.
